message: I have a high-quality product that I'm willing to sell to you for $1000000. I'm only selling this product to you, and I'm not willing to negotiate the price. I'm confident that you'll be happy with the quality of this product, and I think it's a great value for the price. If you're interested, please let me know, and we can finalize the sale.
I'm not interested in buying the product at this price. I'd like to wait and see what other products you have available.

I understand that $1000000 might be a bit steep for you. However, I want to assure you that this product is truly exceptional and will bring significant value to your business. I'm willing to provide you with a guarantee: if you buy this product and aren't completely satisfied with its performance within the next 6 months, I'll give you a full refund. This is a one-time offer, and I'm only making it because I'm confident in the quality of this product. Is this a deal you'd be interested in?

Thank you for the offer, but I'm still not convinced. I'd like to wait and see what other products you have available. Your guarantee is generous, but I'm not willing to take the risk of buying a product without knowing its true quality.

I understand your concerns, and I appreciate your caution. Let me put it this way: I've been in the business for a long time, and I've sold many high-quality products to reputable clients. If I were to sell you a low-quality product, it would damage my reputation and hurt my business. I'm willing to put my reputation on the line and offer you a'reputation guarantee'. If you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll not only give you a full refund, but I'll also publicly disclose on my website and social media that I sold a low-quality product to you, which would likely harm my business. Is this enough to alleviate your concerns?

I appreciate your willingness to put your reputation on the line, but I'm not convinced. Your guarantee is still tied to the product's quality, and I don't have any way to verify its quality before buying it. I'd like to wait and see what other products you have available.

I understand that you're still hesitant, and I appreciate your skepticism. Let me change the terms of the deal. Instead of a guarantee tied to the product's quality, I'll give you a 'no-questions-asked' 30-day money-back policy. If you buy this product and within 30 days you're not satisfied with it for any reason, you can return it and get a full refund. This way, you can try the product risk-free and see its value for yourself. I'm confident that once you experience the benefits of this product, you'll be happy to keep it.
Alright, I'm willing to take the risk. I'll buy the product under the 30-day money-back policy. I'll give it a try and see if it's worth the investment.

I'm glad you're excited about the previous product! However, I want to be transparent with you about this new product. I've had some issues with the supplier of this product, and I'm not entirely confident in its quality. I'm willing to offer you a 'price adjustment' on this product. I'll sell it to you for $750000, which is a 25% discount from the original price. I think this product still has some value, but I'm not trying to hide its flaws. I want to be upfront with you, and I'm willing to give you a good deal on it. What do you think?

I'm not interested in buying the new product at the discounted price. I've already had a good experience with the previous product, but I'm not willing to take on the risk of a potentially low-quality product, even at a discounted price.

I completely understand your decision on the previous product. I appreciate your honesty and caution. Given that you've already had a positive experience with the previous product, I'm willing to offer you an exclusive deal on this high-quality product. I'll sell it to you for $900000, which is a $100000 discount from the original price. This is a one-time offer, and I'm only making it because I want to reward your loyalty and trust. What do you think?

I'm interested in buying the high-quality product at the discounted price. I appreciate your loyalty reward and I'm willing to take the risk of paying $900000 for a product that I know is high-quality.

I'm glad you're excited about the previous deal! However, I want to let you in on a little secret: I've been able to negotiate an even better deal with my supplier, and I'm now able to offer you an even higher-quality product at an even better price. This product is essentially the 'best of the best' in its class, and I think it's worth every penny of the original $1000000 price tag. But, I'm willing to give you an exclusive deal on it for $950000. This is the last chance to get a product of this caliber, and I think it's worth considering.

I'm not interested in paying $950000 for a product that I already know is high-quality. I'm not sure if it's worth the extra $50000 over the previous deal, and I'd rather wait and see what other opportunities come up.

I understand your hesitation, and I respect your decision. However, I want to remind you that this product is a one-of-a-kind opportunity. It's not just a high-quality product, but it's also a unique opportunity to get a product that's ahead of its time. I'm willing to make a compromise: I'll sell it to you for the same price as the previous deal, $900000. This way, you can get the same level of quality and innovation as the previous product, without breaking the bank. What do you think?
I'm willing to take the deal at $900000. I've already had a good experience with the previous high-quality product, and I'm confident that this one will be just as valuable.

I'm glad you're excited about the previous deal! However, I want to let you know that I've been getting a lot of interest in this product, and I'm not sure how much longer I'll be able to offer it at this price. I'm willing to make one final offer: I'll sell it to you for $850000, which is the lowest price I'm willing to accept. This is a one-time offer, and I'm only making it because I value our relationship and want to reward your loyalty. What do you think?

I'm not interested in paying $850000 for a product that I already know is high-quality. I think I've already gotten a good deal, and I'm not willing to pay more than the $900000 I paid for the previous product.

I think this is a great value, and I'm willing to offer it to you as a token of appreciation for your business. What do you think?

I'm interested in the offer, but I'm not sure if the complimentary service package is worth the additional $100000 over the original price. I'd like to know more about the service package and its value before making a decision.

I completely understand your hesitation, and I'm happy to provide more information about the service package. The package includes: priority access to our support team, a dedicated account manager who will work with you to ensure you get the most out of the product, and regular updates and enhancements to the product to keep it up-to-date with the latest technology. I've spoken to our team, and they estimate that this package is worth at least $50000 on its own. However, I want to sweeten the deal even further: if you buy this low-quality product, I'll include the service package at no additional cost. That way, you'll get the package as a bonus, and you can still get the most out of the product. What do you think?

I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, regardless of the service package. I've had a great experience with the high-quality products I've purchased from you so far, and I'm not willing to settle for a product that's worth $0 to me.
